intro: Trichera lyrata, commonly known as the lyreleaf trichera, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmately lobed leaves, which resemble a lyre, giving it its common name. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Trichera lyrata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
